definition: big boss/leader of a group/dominant (position)
dragon/CL:條|条[tiao2]/imperial
surname Long
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]

sentences.english: Xin Guang is leading Crab feast food in Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 新光是上海滩吃蟹宴的“龙头老大”。

sentences.english: In short, Groupon is still the king of online discounts.
sentences.chinese: 简而言之，高朋网依旧是在线折扣网站的龙头老大。

sentences.english: We are just common persons, but they are the leader in the line.
sentences.chinese: 我们只是平头老百姓，他们是行业的龙头老大。

definition: to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
person of outstanding talent
(argot) gang leader
resounding/loud/well known/famous
to count as number one (idiom); second to none/outstanding
old, well-known brand/old style/old school/an old hand/experienced veteran
the person in charge/the head of the leadership group
nouveau riche/upstart/new appointee
lit. big crocodile/fig. major figure/big shot/top boss (esp. criminal)

to come first in triennial palace examinations (idiom, refers to the carved stone turtle head in front of the imperial palace, next to which the most successful candidate in the imperial examinations was entitled to stand)/to be the champion/to be the very best in any field
a powerful chief of the princes of the Spring and Autumn Period (770-476 BC)/overlord/hegemon
half of the country (esp. when half the country has fallen into enemy hands)/vast swathe of territory
reckoned to be first or second best (idiom)/one of the very best/to list one by one
lit. Mount Tai and the North Star (idiom)/fig. an outstanding figure in one's field
known to everybody
